scenario:
Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock has lost 14% of its value in the past year, while Broadcom (AVGO) has jumped 115%. Both companies design chips used in personal computers, smartphones, gaming consoles, and data centers. AMD's third-quarter 2024 results show a turnaround in progress with an 18% year-over-year increase in revenue to $6.8 billion and a 31% spike in earnings per share to $0.92 per share. Analysts project a 22% year-over-year increase in revenue for the fourth quarter to $7.5 billion and a 41% increase in earnings to $1.09 per share.

For 2025, AMD's bottom line is projected to jump by 54% to $5.13 per share on the back of a 27% spike in revenue to $32.5 billion. The company's data center business gained momentum in 2024, and AMD is expected to witness further growth in this segment in 2025 due to an improved supply chain. AMD's share of the client CPU market increased by 4.6 percentage points year over year in the third quarter of 2024 to 23.9%.

Broadcom generated $12.2 billion in revenue last fiscal year from sales of its custom AI processors and networking chips, a massive jump of 220% from the preceding year. Broadcom controls 55% to 60% of the custom processor market and is expected to make the most of the lucrative growth opportunity in AI. The company's AI revenue could jump to $45 billion after three years, a big jump of almost four times over the revenue generated in fiscal 2024.

Broadcom's non-AI semiconductor revenue fell 23% year over year in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2024, but the company is expecting a recovery in this segment going forward. Broadcom's growth in fiscal 2025 is expected to be stronger than last year, with the company finishing fiscal 2024 with organic revenue growth of 9%.

Both AMD and Broadcom are likely to deliver robust growth in 2025 and beyond, but Broadcom is trading at a richer valuation than AMD. AMD is expected to deliver faster growth in the new year, making it a more attractive buy for investors looking for a growth stock trading at an attractive valuation.
